p: Methane (CH 4) is the main atmospheric organic trace gas. CH 4 is the primary component of natural gas, a worldwide fuel source. Significant emissions of CH 4 result from cattle farming and agriculture, but mainly as a consequence of fossil fuel use. Concentrations of CH 4 were multiplied by two since the pre-industrial era. The present worldwide-averaged concentration is of 1.8 Î¼mol.mol -1 ( IPCC, 2014).
